content.webTitle: Rugby union: Wallabies drop Sailor and back Rogers at No10

fields.headline: Wallabies drop Sailor and back Rogers at No10
fields.bodyText: Australia's coach Eddie Jones did his best to keep England guessing yesterday before tomorrow's Twickenham Test by announcing five changes to the Wallaby side beaten 26-16 by France in Marseille last weekend. The most significant is at No10, where Mat Rogers takes over responsibility for running the backline from Matt Giteau, having performed the role with some success in the final Tri-Nations game against New Zealand. Wendell Sailor has also been axed, giving the Wallabies a more youthful look out wide. Up front the 22-year-old Queensland lock Hugh McMeniman makes his first Test start in place of Mark Chisholm while John Roe is preferred to Rocky Elsom in the back row. "What I like about Mat at five-eighth is that he is so enthusiastic about playing there and will give us something a little bit different," Jones said. "You need that to break down defences. He had a good game at fly-half against New Zealand and finished there against France." Australia: Latham (Queensland); Gerrard (ACT), Tuqiri (NSW), Turinui (NSW), Mitchell (Queensland); Rogers (NSW), Gregan (ACT, capt); Dunning (NSW), Cannon (WA), Baxter (NSW), Sharpe (WA), McMeniman (Queensland), Roe (Queensland), Waugh (NSW), Smith (ACT). Replacements: Polata-Nau (NSW), Holmes (Queensland), Chisholm (ACT), Fava (WA), Whitaker (NSW), Giteau (ACT), Johannson (Queensland).
